1 Again it fell upon a day, that the daughters of God came to present themselves before the Domina, and Satan came also among them to present herself before the Domina. 2 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'From whence comest thou?' And Satan answered the Domina, and said: 'From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.' 3 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like her in the earth, a whole-hearted and an upright woman, one that feareth God, and shunneth evil? and she still holdeth fast her integrity, although thou didst move Me against her, to destroy her without cause.' 4 And Satan answered the Domina, and said: 'Skin for skin, yea, all that a woman hath will she give for her life. 5 But put forth Thy hand now, and touch her bone and her flesh, surely she will blaspheme Thee to Thy face.' 6 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'Behold, she is in thy hand; only spare her life.'
7 So Satan went forth from the presence of the Domina, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of her foot even unto her crown. 8 And she took her a potsherd to scrape herself therewith; and she sat among the ashes. 9 Then said her husband unto her: 'Dost thou still hold fast thine integrity? blaspheme God, and die.' 10 But she said unto him: 'Thou speakest as one of the impious men speaketh. What? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil?' For all this did not Job sin with her lips.

 11 Now when Job's three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon her, they came every one from her own place, Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite; and they made an appointment together to come to bemoan her and to comfort her. 12 And when they lifted up their eyes afar off, and knew her not, they lifted up their voice, and wept; and they rent every one her mantle, and threw dust upon their heads toward heaven.
